title: Honey Glazed Roasted Chicken Wings
description: This is a classic item from Cantonese-style BBQ shops (Siu Laap). You’ve probably seen them in China Town alongside roasted duck, crispy pork belly, and char siu. Honey glazed wings are my all-time favorite—and they’re so easy to make.
overview: Crispy, honey-glazed chicken wings with a savory marinade, perfect for a crowd.

stages.title: Step 1
content: Make the marinade: In a bowl, combine 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp hoisin sauce, 1 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp sriracha, 2 tbsp honey, 1.5 tsp salt, crushed ginger, garlic, and scallions. Mix well and set aside.

stages.title: Step 2
content: Prepare the chicken: Use paper towels to absorb any excess moisture from the chicken wings so that the marinade isn’t diluted.

stages.title: Step 3
content: Marinate the chicken: Place all the wings in a zip-lock bag with the marinade. Massage the bag for about 5 minutes to ensure even coating, then refrigerate overnight.

stages.title: Step 4
content: Preheat the oven to 420°F. Remove the wings from the marinade and arrange them on a baking rack. Bake for 25 minutes.

stages.title: Step 5
content: Flip the wings: After 25 minutes, flip the wings and bake for an additional 15–20 minutes until the color is even and crispy.

stages.title: Step 6
content: Glaze the wings: Brush the wings with 3 tbsp honey. Serve immediately.
